title: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in Win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in Win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: The problem with the current implementation is that the method throws a NoClassDefFoundError, which is not defined in the CLDC class libraries. This causes a problem in the CLDC version of SWT. This issue can only be observed if verified or used jxeLink or something similar as the compiler assumes NoClassDefFoundError is available.
EB: To resolve this issue, we should add a private constructor to the BidiUtil class. Since there are no nonstatic methods in this class, it is unnecessary for it to have a public constructor. Making the constructor private would prevent people from instantiating the class unnecessarily, without adding any additional size to the class.
SR:
To reproduce the issue and verify the fix: 

1. Open the BidiUtil class in org.eclipse.swt.internal package. 
2. Locate the line with the static Callback initialization. 
3. Replace the usage of 'new Callback (BidiUtil.class, "windowProc", 4)' with a private constructor for BidiUtil. 
4. Recompile the code and run it using CLDC version of SWT. 
5. Verify that the NoClassDefFoundError is no longer thrown.
